business.headline: From ban to profit sharing: Inside US deal with Nvidia, AMD on China chip salesThe deal makes the US a direct financial beneficiary of sensitive technology sales to a geopolitical rival. This article looks into the key details of this first-of-its-kind agreement.

ICICI Bank new minimum balance rules: FAQs, charges, and key informationIn metro and urban branches, the minimum average balance will jump from Rs 10,000 to Rs 50,000. For semi-urban areas, it will increase from Rs 5,000 to Rs 25,000.

Borrowed cash from a friend? You may end up paying income tax penaltyThe income tax department is strict when it comes to large cash transactions. Whether it's taking a loan, repaying one, or even making donations, there are limits you need to follow. Go beyond those, and you could face a penalty equal to the entire amount involved.

BlueStone Jewellery IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe?The IPO consists of a fresh issue of 1.59 crore shares worth Rs 820 crore and an offer for sale of 1.39 crore shares worth Rs 720.65 crore.

SBI shares rise 2% over Q1 results. Should you buy?SBI share price: The rise came after SBI posted a standalone net profit of Rs 19,160 crore for the June quarter (Q1FY26), up from Rs 17,035 crore in the same quarter last year.

Voltas shares slide nearly 8% after sharp Q1 profit declineAt around 9:55 am, shares of Voltas were trading 5.86% lower at Rs 1,227.35.  The company reported a steep 58% year-on-year decline in net profit to Rs 140.6 crore, weighed down by unseasonal weather and subdued summer demand, which impacted air conditioner sales.

Sensex back above 80,000 as markets eye Trump-Putin meeting outcomeThe S&P BSE Sensex was trading 157.26 points higher at 80,015.05 at 9:26 am, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 43.60 points to trade at 24,406.90. Most of the other broader market indices were mixed.

NSDL turns into a multibagger for investors: Will it continue to gain?Issued at Rs 800, the stock opened at Rs 880 and has raced to Rs 1,300.30, minting massive gains for early institutional investors and retail shareholders alike.

ICICI Bank hikes minimum savings balance to Rs 50,000: What it means for youThe change applies to all new accounts opened after that date, setting a new benchmark in the industry for the highest MAB requirement among domestic banks.

Ease of doing business: Piyush Goyal resolves Swiss firm's land issue in hoursUnion Minister Piyush Goyal resolved a complex land allocation issue for a major Swiss company during a live business conference, highlighting the ease of business in India.

Trump's tariff war: Is this India's 1991 moment? Montek Singh Ahluwalia exclusiveAt the Business Today India@100 Summit, Montek Singh Ahluwalia, former Deputy Chairman of the Planning Commission, discusses if the 2025 Trump tariff war presents a 1991-like moment for India.

Piyush Goyal exclusive: Whole world recognises India as fastest-growing economyUnion Minister Piyush Goyal hailed the Indian economy and said the whole world recognises us as the fastest-growing large economy.

entertainment.headline: Ananya Panday, Suhana Khan enjoy movie night with AbRam. WatchAnanya Panday and Suhana Khan recently stepped out for a movie night in Mumbai with Suhana's younger brother, AbRam. A video from their outing has emerged online.

Abhishek and Aishwarya Bachchan pose for selfies with fans in new videoAbhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai, who recently returned from a family holiday, clicked selfies with fans at the Mumbai airport. Several fans have shared the photos online. The couple had gone on a holiday with their daughter Aaradhya.

Coolie advance booking storm: Rajinikanth on track for Rs 100 crore Day 1 rampageRajinikanth's 'Coolie' is rewriting box office history even before release, raking in over Rs 51 crore in Day 1 pre-sales and eyeing a Rs 100 crore global opening - a record-breaking storm for Tamil cinema.

Lokesh Kanagaraj reacts to fan theories on sci-fi and time travel in CoolieWith theories around time travel and a sci-fi twist doing the rounds, director Lokesh Kanagaraj has maintained suspense around the plot of 'Coolie'. The film, which stars Rajinikanth in a mass action role, is set for release on August 14 and will clash with 'War 2' at the box office.

I'll stop and leave: Jr NTR snaps at fan interrupting his speech at War 2 eventJr NTR lost his cool after a fan interrupted his speech by continuously screaming at 'War 2' event. He snapped at him and asked him to stay silent till he finished his speech.

Bhansali to shoot Love & War at British-era Army base in Madhya Pradesh: SourceSanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Love & War' to begin shooting in Madhya Pradesh. A source told India Today that the 15-day schedule is expected to begin soon.

Salman Khan warns crowd to make way for him and niece Ayat at event. Watch videoActor Salman Khan took on the role of a protective uncle for his niece, Ayat Sharma. He held her hand and even carried her in his arms as they attended an event together.

Zaheer Iqbal surprises Sonakshi Sinha with new age DDLJ train prank. WatchSonakshi Sinha and husband Zaheer Iqbal shared a hilarious train prank video, with Sonakshi calling it a "new age DDLJ" moment.

Ahaan Panday meets fans on road, click selfies amid Saiyaara's success. WatchActor Ahaan Panday is enjoying the success of his latest hit 'Saiyaara'. Amid all the love, the actor recently met fans on the roads and even clicked selfies with them.

Lara Dutta gives shout-out to Deanne Panday after son Ahaan's Saiyaara successActor Lara Dutta commended Deanne Panday for her steadfast support and commitment as a mother to son Ahaan Panday, emphasising her devotion to both family and friends. Ahaan debuted in Bollywood with 'Saiyaara'.
Taarak Mehta's OG Dayaben Disha Vakani celebrates Raksha Bandhan with Asit Modi'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' producer Asit Modi marked Raksha Bandhan with Disha Vakani and shared pictures online.

Priyanka Chopra reacts as daughter Malti is hit by bag at airportActor Priyanka Chopra was seen with her daughter at Hyderabad airport, where fans captured Malti enjoying a ride on a trolley. The actor was in the city for the shooting of SS Rajamouli and Mahesh Babu's film.

Allu Arjun asked to remove mask at airport, fans react to viral videoActor Allu Arjun was seen having a conversation with the CISF official at an airport recently. He was asked to remove his mask for identification and a video of the same has gone viral on social media.

Distressed: Aamir Khan's family denies mistreatment allegations by brother FaissalAamir Khan's family has responded to Faissal Khan's allegations, firmly denying any mistreatment. They stated that all decisions were taken out of concern for his well-being and based on medical advice.

Hrithik Roshan praises Jr NTR at War 2 event: He is a one-take actor, learnt a lotHrithik Roshan commended Jr NTR's dedication as they promoted 'War 2' in Hyderabad. The Bollywood actor called Jr NTR a 'one-take final-take actor'.

Janhvi Kapoor shines in red lehenga for Masaba Gupta's bridal collection. VideoJanhvi Kapoor impressed fans with her beautiful bridal look for designer Masaba Gupta's new collection. She wore a bright red lehenga with detailed embroidery and traditional designs, paired with big earrings, a maang teeka, and delicate kaleeras.

Music composer Dony Hazarika's mother dies in car accident in MumbaiMusic composer Dony Hazarika's mother, Sultana Kishore Ahmed Hazarika, died when their Uber car hit a crane in Mumbai's Vikhroli area. Dony and the caretaker were also hurt, and the police have filed a case against the Uber driver.

Deepika Padukone steps away from acting in The Intern remake: ReportDeepika Padukone has stepped away from acting in 'The Intern' remake to concentrate on producing it. The project, co-starring Amitabh Bachchan, has faced multiple delays since it was announced in 2020.

You can't question the jury: Shoojit Sircar on SRK, Kerala Story National Awards rowAmid the debate over Shah Rukh Khan winning Best Actor and 'The Kerala Story' bagging Best Film at the National Film Awards, filmmaker Shoojit Sircar said the jury's decision should be final and beyond question. He added that while opinions may differ, it's the sensibilities of the appointed jury that ultimately matter.

general news.headline: Live: Rahul Gandhi, other Opposition MPs detained during 'vote chori' protest marchParliament Monsoon Session Live Updates: With just 10 days remaining in the Monsoon Session, both the Rajya Sabha and Lok Sabha are expected to have a packed agenda, including the introduction of the Income Tax Bill. The Houses are also likely to witness Opposition protests over the Bihar voters list and the 'vote chori' allegations, particularly after the Election Commission's notice to Leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha, Rahul Gandhi. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in for the latest updates from Parliament.

Top court orders immediate capture of Delhi-NCR stray dogs, warns against interferenceThe Supreme Court ordered Delhi-NCR authorities to urgently catch, sterilise, and permanently relocate stray dogs to shelters, warning that any individual or organisation obstructing the process would face legal action.
Now 'Cat Kumar', son of 'Catty Boss', applies for ID proof in BiharA 'Cat Kumar', son of 'Catty Boss', applied for a residential certificate in Bihar, leading to a police case and investigation.

Will take half the world down with us: Asim Munir threatens nuke wipeout from USPakistan Army chief Asim Munir issued nuclear threat against India during his US visit, warning of severe retaliation over conflicts. Munir also met senior US military and political leaders, following a rare June visit with President Trump.

ChatGPT 5 hints AI surge finally slowing but humans are still cookedIf ChatGPT 5 is any indication, then it seems the era of "transformers" is over. What comes next in AI is not yet certain. Except that it is already smarter than humans in many aspects.

From ban to profit sharing: Inside US deal with Nvidia, AMD on China chip salesThe deal makes the US a direct financial beneficiary of sensitive technology sales to a geopolitical rival. This article looks into the key details of this first-of-its-kind agreement.

Mob vandalises tomb outside UP mausoleum, claims it is built on top of temple A group of people from a Hindu organisation vandalised a tomb outside a mausoleum in Uttar Pradesh's Fatehpur, claiming the complex was built on top of temple.

Borrowed cash from a friend? You may end up paying income tax penaltyThe income tax department is strict when it comes to large cash transactions. Whether it's taking a loan, repaying one, or even making donations, there are limits you need to follow. Go beyond those, and you could face a penalty equal to the entire amount involved.

Gujarat man and lion startle each other after chance encounter. Video goes viralA man had a rare close encounter with a lion near a cement factory in Gujarat late at night. A video of the moment has gone viral on social media.

Israel has succeeded: Haunting final message of Gaza journalist killed in strikeGaza journalist Anas al-Sharif, who was killed in an Israeli strike on Sunday, left behind a will urging the world not to abandon besieged Gaza and the Palestinian people. The will was shared on X after his death.

How attack on Christian priests, nuns in Odisha feeds into a wider trendEarlier, two Catholic nuns from Kerala were arrested in Chhattisgarh for alleged human trafficking and forced religious conversions, sparking nationwide outrage

Can't reserve posts for men: Top court slams male-female quota in Army's legal branchThe Supreme Court called the 2:1 male-to-female reservation in the Army's JAG branch arbitrary and unconstitutional, ruling that recruitment must be gender-neutral and based on merit.

Coolie advance booking storm: Rajinikanth on track for Rs 100 crore Day 1 rampageRajinikanth's 'Coolie' is rewriting box office history even before release, raking in over Rs 51 crore in Day 1 pre-sales and eyeing a Rs 100 crore global opening - a record-breaking storm for Tamil cinema.

UP man finds meat piece in veg meal ordered online, restaurant admits mix-upA man in Uttar Pradesh alleged that his online vegetarian meal order was mistakenly served with chicken on the last day of Sawan during Raksha Bandhan celebrations.
First look of Tesla's new showroom in Delhi's AerocityTesla has strengthened its India presence by opening a second showroom in Delhi's Aerocity, following its Mumbai debut in July 2025.

NSDL turns into a multibagger for investors: Will it continue to gain?Issued at Rs 800, the stock opened at Rs 880 and has raced to Rs 1,300.30, minting massive gains for early institutional investors and retail shareholders alike.

Beaten, bite marks on body: Video shows assault on toddler at Noida day careA 15-month-old girl was assaulted by a maid at a day care centre in Noida after she was crying continuously. The incident was caught on CCTV.

Congess MP claims runway scare after Air India flight diverted, airline clarifiesCongress MP KC Venugopal said that the passengers on board AI 2455 operating from Thiruvananthapuram to Delhi were saved by sheer luck and skill of the pilots after the flight was diverted to Chennai following a reported technical glitch.

Lord Ram lost his mind after losing Sita: Tamil poet's comments spark rowWhile receiving an award named after Tamil poet Kambar, lyricist Vairamuthu said Lord Ram "lost his mind" after losing Sita, citing a dialogue in Kamba Ramayanam. His comments have sparked controversy and drawn criticism.

ICICI Bank new minimum balance rules: FAQs, charges, and key informationIn metro and urban branches, the minimum average balance will jump from Rs 10,000 to Rs 50,000. For semi-urban areas, it will increase from Rs 5,000 to Rs 25,000.

Why urban hobosexuality is quite a thing in India now (or at least becoming one)Hobosexuality refers to a pattern where someone enters a romantic relationship primarily for housing or financial support, often under the guise of a deep emotional connection.

If Ratan Tata were here...: Air India crash victims' lawyer slams payout delayUS Attorney Mike Andrews, representing Air India crash victims' families, said the late industrialist's legacy of humility and care for people could have ensured that grieving families did not face procedural hurdles.

Trump 'thinking about' tariffs on China over Russian oil imports: JD VanceThe US president is considering imposing tariffs on China for buying Russian oil, Vice President JD Vance said, following recent duties on India. China's imports from Russia hit $10 billion in July amid US threats.

Not a court: P Chidambaram's swipe at poll body over notice to Rahul GandhiChidambaram said that the Election Commission is not a court but an administrative body with responsibility for holding free and fair elections across the country.

Ananya Panday, Suhana Khan enjoy movie night with AbRam. WatchAnanya Panday and Suhana Khan recently stepped out for a movie night in Mumbai with Suhana's younger brother, AbRam. A video from their outing has emerged online.

Abhishek and Aishwarya Bachchan pose for selfies with fans in new videoAbhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai, who recently returned from a family holiday, clicked selfies with fans at the Mumbai airport. Several fans have shared the photos online. The couple had gone on a holiday with their daughter Aaradhya.

The film, which stars Rajinikanth in a mass action role, is set for release on August 14 and will clash with 'War 2' at the box office.

sports.headline: Wish Bumrah played all Tests, who remembers wickets taken in IPL?: VengasarkarFormer India batter and chief selector Dilip Vengasarkar said that Jasprit Bumrah should've played all the Tests in the recently concluded five-match series against England as nobody remembers IPL performances.

Liverpool boss Arne Slot refuses to panic after Community Shield lossLiverpool boss Arne Slot doesn't feel there is a need to panic after their penalty shootout loss to Crystal Palace in the Community Shield on Sunday, August 10. Liverpool let the lead slip twice during the game and lost 2-3 in the shoot-out.

Watch: MS Dhoni's hilarious response to fan's request to play IPL 2026MS Dhoni's witty reply to a fan's IPL 2026 request sparked laughter, while his future remains undecided. The CSK legend says he'll take time until December before making the big call.

Cricket's loss, javelin's gain: Sri Lanka's Rumesh, the new kid on the blockIn Bhubaneswar on Sunday, Rumesh Pathirage's 86.50m throw shattered Sri Lanka's national record and confirmed his place at the World Championships. Having traded the cricket ball for the javelin, the 22-year-old is now hurtling onto the world stage as a rising force from the island nation with his eyes set on Olympic glory.

Never imagined would speak to Virat Kohli: Fans recall Patidar sim mix-up experienceA Chhattisgarh man, named Manish Bisi, received calls from Virat Kohli and AB de Villiers after a SIM card mix-up with RCB captain Rajat Patidar. The surreal experience left Manish and his friend Khenraj thrilled.

AIFF announces cash prize for U-20 women's team after Asia Cup qualificationIndia's U20 women's football team secured their first AFC U-20 Women's Asian Cup qualification since 2006, topping Group D unbeaten. The AIFF have decided to reward the team for their effort by giving a cash prize to the players.

WI vs PAK 2nd ODI: Roston Chase's all-round effort sees West Indies level seriesAn all-round effort from Roston Chase and Sherfane Rutherford's blitz helped West Indies secure a five-wicket win in the second ODI on Sunday, August 10. The win in the rain-marred match helped the hosts to level the series heading into the decider.

In Pics: How Odisha aced the 1st Indian Continental TourOdisha successfully hosted the first ever Continental Tour in India. Here's how the entire event came together and how the Odisha government delivered an exceptional show on Sunday, August 10.

Chennai Grand Masters: Nihal downs Erigaisi, Keymer extends leadVincent Keymer extends his lead at Chennai Grand Masters as Arjun Erigaisi is defeated by Nihal Sarin. Abhimanyu Puranik takes Challengers' lead with a win over Vaishali Rameshbabu.

Roger Federer returns: Swiss legend to play in Shanghai Masters 202520-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer is making a memorable comeback at the 2025 Shanghai Masters by playing in the "Roger & Friends" celebrity doubles event on October 10.

Kohli, Rohit Sharma to retire after Australia ODIs? Ganguly weighs inSourav Ganguly dismissed rumours of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma retiring from ODIs after the Australia tour, saying he has no information on this. He emphasised that their future should depend solely on their performance.

WI vs PAK 2nd ODI: Roston Chase's all-round effort sees West Indies level seriesAn all-round effort from Roston Chase and Sherfane Rutherford's blitz helped West Indies secure a five-wicket win in the second ODI on Sunday, August 10. The win in the rain-marred match helped the hosts to level the series heading into the decider.

In Pics: How Odisha aced the 1st Indian Continental TourOdisha successfully hosted the first ever Continental Tour in India. Here's how the entire event came together and how the Odisha government delivered an exceptional show on Sunday, August 10.

Roger Federer returns: Swiss legend to play in Shanghai Masters 202520-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer is making a memorable comeback at the 2025 Shanghai Masters by playing in the "Roger & Friends" celebrity doubles event on October 10.

Kohli, Rohit Sharma to retire after Australia ODIs? Ganguly weighs inSourav Ganguly dismissed rumours of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma retiring from ODIs after the Australia tour, saying he has no information on this. He emphasised that their future should depend solely on their performance.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
